Package com.williambarkoff.csx.riemann

Class AbstractRiemann

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.williambarkoff.csx.riemann.AbstractRiemann
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LeftHandRule, MaximumRule, MidpointRule, MinimumRule, RandomRule, RightHandRule, TrapezoidRule
    public abstract class AbstractRiemann
extends java.lang.Object
    Class riemann represents a Riemann sum. A rule, such as RightHandRule or TrapezoidRule, implements the Riemann class and is used to determine the shape of the slice to calculate the Riemann sum.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AbstractRiemann()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double calculateDeltaX​(double left, double right, int subintervals)
      Calculates Δx based on the endpoints of the Riemann sum and the number of subintervals; in other words, this method finds the width of each rectangle.
      double rs​(org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly, double left, double right, int subintervals)
      Calculates a Riemann sum, using the particular implementation of slice​(org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial, double, double) defined in the subclass.
      void rsAcc​(org.opensourcephysics.frames.PlotFrame pframe, org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly, double precision, double left, double right)
      Graphs the accumulation function corresponding to the input polynomial and the input left hand endpoint.
      void rsPlot​(org.opensourcephysics.frames.PlotFrame pframe, org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly, double precision, double left, double right, int subintervals)
      Plots a Riemann sum in a given PlotFrame.
      abstract double slice​(org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly, double sleft, double sright)
      Approximates a slice of the (signed) area between the graph of a polynomial and the x-axis, over a given interval on the x-axis.
      abstract void slicePlot​(org.opensourcephysics.frames.PlotFrame pframe, org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly, double sleft, double sright)
      Plots a slice of the (signed) area between the graph of a polynomial and the x-axis, over a given interval on the x-axis.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateDeltaX

        public double calculateDeltaX​(double left,
                              double right,
                              int subintervals)
        Calculates Δx based on the endpoints of the Riemann sum and the number of subintervals; in other words, this method finds the width of each rectangle.
        Parameters:
        left - the left hand endpoint of the Riemann sum
        right - the right hand endpoint of the Riemann
        subintervals - the number of sub-intervals into which to divide the interval
        Returns:
        Δx

      • rs

        public double rs​(org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly,
                 double left,
                 double right,
                 int subintervals)
        Calculates a Riemann sum, using the particular implementation of slice​(org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial, double, double) defined in the subclass.
        Parameters:
        poly - the polynomial whose Riemann sum is to be calculated
        left - the left hand endpoint of the Riemann sums
        right - the right hand endpoint of the Riemann sum
        subintervals - the number of subintervals into which to divide the interval
        Returns:
        An approximation of the Riemann sum over the interval [left, right].

      • rsAcc

        public void rsAcc​(org.opensourcephysics.frames.PlotFrame pframe,
                  org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly,
                  double precision,
                  double left,
                  double right)
        Graphs the accumulation function corresponding to the input polynomial and the input left hand endpoint. This method uses the specific implementation of slicePlot​(org.opensourcephysics.frames.PlotFrame, org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial, double, double) defined in the subclass.
        Parameters:
        pframe - the PlotFrame on which the polynomial and the Riemann sum are drawn
        poly - the polynomial whose accumulation function is to be calculated
        precision - the difference between the x-coordinates of two adjacent points on the graph of the accumulation function
        left - the left hand endpoint of the accumulation function
        right - the right hand endpoint of the accumulation function

      • rsPlot

        public void rsPlot​(org.opensourcephysics.frames.PlotFrame pframe,
                   org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly,
                   double precision,
                   double left,
                   double right,
                   int subintervals)
        Plots a Riemann sum in a given PlotFrame.
        Parameters:
        pframe - the PlotFrame on which the polynomial and the Riemann sum are drawn
        poly - the polynomial whose Riemann sum is to be calculated
        precision - the difference between the x-coordinates of two adjacent points on the graph of the function
        left - the left hand endpoint of the Riemann sum
        right - the right hand endpoint of the Riemann sum
        subintervals - the number of subintervals into which to divide the interval

      • slice

        public abstract double slice​(org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly,
                             double sleft,
                             double sright)
        Approximates a slice of the (signed) area between the graph of a polynomial and the x-axis, over a given interval on the x-axis. The specific Riemann sum rule used in the calculation is defined by the subclass. This method should be used in rs(Polynomial, double, double, int) to find the total area.
        Parameters:
        poly - the polynomial whose area (over or under the x-axis), over the interval from sleft to sright, is to be calculated
        sleft - the left hand endpoint of the interval
        sright - the right hand endpoint of the interval
        Returns:
        A slice of the riemann sum

      • slicePlot

        public abstract void slicePlot​(org.opensourcephysics.frames.PlotFrame pframe,
                               org.dalton.polyfun.Polynomial poly,
                               double sleft,
                               double sright)
        Plots a slice of the (signed) area between the graph of a polynomial and the x-axis, over a given interval on the x-axis. The specific Riemann sum rule used is defined by the subclass. This method should be used in rsPlot(PlotFrame, Polynomial, double, double, double, int) to find the total area.
        Parameters:
        pframe - the PlotFrame on which the slicePlot is to be drawn
        poly - the polynomial whose area (over or under the x-axis), over the interval from sleft to sright, is to be drawn
        sleft - the left hand endpoint of the interval
        sright - the right hand endpoint of the interval
